intro: Hamelinia, commonly known as the red-flowered bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, tubular or bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be found in various habitats, including woodlands and meadows. Hamelinia species often have opposite leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
